senses.lear_examp: Naturally, these are more difficult factors to cope with for older people, but it just happens to anyone if you're not in the right frame of mind.

senses.sense: a feeling that you do not need to worry about anything
senses.dict_examp: For my peace of mind, please check that the door is locked.
senses.lear_examp: After all, successfully earning your living guarantees peace of mind.

senses.sense: the ability to deal with a difficult situation quickly and effectively
senses.dict_examp: She had the presence of mind to press the alarm.
senses.lear_examp: Frank tried to hide a bag behind his back with great presence of mind.

senses.sense: If something slips your mind, you forget about it.
senses.dict_examp: I meant to tell her you had phoned, but it completely slipped my mind.
senses.lear_examp: There was something but it slipped my mind before I reached it.

senses.sense: to try to remember
senses.dict_examp: If you cast your mind back, you might recall that I never promised to go.
senses.lear_examp: Thus, when I pick one of these stones, I cast my mind back to the specific place where I found it, the person I was, the particular moment.

senses.sense: something you say when politely asking if you can do something, or when asking someone else to do something
senses.dict_examp: Do you mind if  I turn the television on?
senses.lear_examp: Do you mind if I bring a friend?

senses.sense: used to say the choice is not important when responding to an offer or suggestion
senses.dict_examp: "Would you like tea or coffee?" "I don't mind - either."
senses.lear_examp: I don't mind what we do.

senses.sense: used to tell someone not to worry about something because it is not important
senses.dict_examp: "I'm afraid I've lost that wallet you gave me." "Well, never mind, I can easily buy you another one."
senses.lear_examp: Never mind Ally, forget it, I know you've been busy.

senses.sense: to be annoyed, unhappy or worried by something
senses.dict_examp: Would she mind if I came too?
senses.lear_examp: I want to borrow your bicycle if you don't mind because mine doesn't work well.

senses.sense: used to request something politely
senses.dict_examp: Would you mind sharing a room?
senses.lear_examp: Would you mind if I called you, to know what I've missed?

senses.sense: used to tell someone in that you are annoyed and they should not ask about something  private
senses.dict_examp: I wish you'd just mind your own business.
senses.lear_examp: Despite knowing that he was only doing what he thought was best for me, I couldn't stand him, and I often told him to mind his own business.

senses.sense: to not understand someone or something correctly
senses.dict_examp: He misunderstood the question completely.
senses.lear_examp: He meant that he had misunderstood the situation.

senses.sense: If someone is misunderstood, other people do not understand that they have good qualities.
senses.dict_examp: He was a genius, but misunderstood by society at the time.
senses.lear_examp: He was misunderstood by the adult world, he only wanted to be away from everybody, he wanted to be all by himself.

senses.sense: someone's duty or purpose in life
senses.dict_examp: Her mission in life was to help the poor.
senses.lear_examp: You think that you are "great," since you can cope with both the job and lots of other "missions" in life, education, sports and so on.

senses.sense: an important job, usually traveling somewhere
senses.dict_examp: I'll be going on a fact-finding mission to Paris next week.
senses.lear_examp: Apparently somebody had tried to sabotage the mission and given them both different code words.

senses.sense: If you are mistaken, or you have a mistaken belief, you are wrong about something.
senses.dict_examp: If you think you can behave like that, you are mistaken.
senses.lear_examp: First of all, you mentioned in the article that we promised 45 stalls for that day, but you are completely mistaken as we announced only 35.

senses.sense: If two or more substances mix, they combine to make one substance, and if you mix two or more substances, you combine them to make one substance.
senses.dict_examp: Oil and water don't mix.
senses.lear_examp: I can work at the bar mixing drinks.

senses.sense: to have two or more qualities, or to do two or more activities, etc. at the same time
senses.dict_examp: a feeling of anger mixed with sadness
senses.lear_examp: That also could be a good way to mix learning and entertainment.

senses.sense: to meet and talk to people
senses.dict_examp: She enjoys going to parties and mixing with people.
senses.lear_examp: I like mixing with people.

senses.sense: to confuse two people or things by thinking that one person or thing is the other person or thing
senses.dict_examp: People often mix up the sisters because they look so similar.
senses.lear_examp: My role was to arrange all the cables for the light and sound, and now we are talking cables of about the length of 100 m each. I'd really had a lot to do not to get them mixed up.

senses.sense: a combination of things or people, often in a group
senses.dict_examp: There's a good mix of nationalities in the class.
senses.lear_examp: This film is a mix of fantasy and adventure.

senses.sense: an accident or unlucky event which usually is not serious
senses.dict_examp: They suffered a series of mishaps during the trip.
senses.lear_examp: Personally speaking, I have always received courteous attention from my parents and this has helped me overcome all mishaps that may occur.

senses.sense: a substance made of other substances that have been combined
senses.dict_examp: The mixture of flour, water and yeast is then left in a warm place for four hours.

senses.sense: when there is a combination of two or more ideas, qualities, styles, etc.
senses.dict_examp: Their house is decorated in a mixture of styles.
senses.lear_examp: The result is a very strange mixture of different styles.

senses.sense: to lose something temporarily by forgetting where you have put it
senses.dict_examp: I seem to have misplaced my keys.
senses.lear_examp: It is only when these possessions are lost or stolen or simply misplaced that they are greatly missed.

senses.sense: great suffering or unhappiness
senses.dict_examp: The war brought misery to millions of people.
senses.lear_examp: A few hours of amusement for us might mean a whole life of misery for the animals.

senses.sense: making someone believe something that is untrue
senses.dict_examp: misleading information/statements
senses.lear_examp: I found it rather misleading and I would like to provide true information about the festival.

senses.sense: to give someone false information
senses.dict_examp: I'm afraid you've been misinformed about your test results.
senses.lear_examp: From the article, I got the impression that your reporter was misinformed about certain facts which are crucial for a better understanding of the event.

senses.sense: to make someone believe something that is untrue by giving them information that is wrong or not complete
senses.dict_examp: She claims the public was misled by the government.
senses.lear_examp: I would like to point out that some information in the article was wrong, which could mislead your readers.

senses.sense: to understand something in the wrong way
senses.dict_examp: He claims his speech was deliberately misinterpreted by journalists.
senses.lear_examp: A direct consequence of this is that adults misinterpret their intentions and object to youth's lack of respect.

senses.sense: small drops of water in the air which make it difficult to see objects which are not near
senses.dict_examp: The early-morning mist soon lifted/cleared.
senses.lear_examp: The mist was getting thicker all the time and the rain was coming down harder.

senses.sense: a title for a girl or woman who is not married, used before her family name or full name
senses.dict_examp: Dr. White will see you now, Miss Carter.
senses.lear_examp: Dear Miss Timson, How are you?

senses.sense: a verb, for example "can," "might" or "must," that is used before another verb to show that something is possible, necessary, etc.
senses.dict_examp: The first verb in the following sentence is a modal: We ought to pay the gas bill.

senses.sense: when something is understood in the wrong way
senses.dict_examp: What he said was a complete misinterpretation of my views.
senses.lear_examp: As written in the letter, which I hope you have received from my friend, I worked with in this organization, we want to inform you of the true version in order to avoid misinterpretations and misunderstandings.

senses.sense: when someone does not understand something correctly
senses.dict_examp: There must have been a misunderstanding.
senses.lear_examp: I suppose there was a misunderstanding, because he told me on the phone that he had arranged with you to come next week.

senses.sense: to use something in the wrong way or for the wrong purpose
senses.dict_examp: He misused his position to obtain money dishonestly.
senses.lear_examp: By doing this the money won't be misused because we won't have to build a new indoor court that will not be used at all times.

senses.sense: the use of something in the wrong way or for the wrong purpose
senses.dict_examp: They accused him of misuse of power.
senses.lear_examp: Can we disregard the consequences there may be of the misuse of the above innovations of technology?

senses.sense: to not go to something
senses.dict_examp: You'll fall behind in your studies if you keep missing school.
senses.lear_examp: You only missed the best party of the year!

senses.sense: to feel sad about someone that you do not see now or something that you do not have or do now
senses.dict_examp: I really missed her when she went away.
senses.lear_examp: I miss you a lot.

senses.sense: to arrive too late to get on a bus, train, aircraft, etc.
senses.dict_examp: You'll miss your train if you don't hurry up.
senses.lear_examp: Even if we missed the train, I was happy and this was the most important thing.

senses.sense: to not use an opportunity to do something
senses.dict_examp: You can't afford to miss a chance like this.
senses.lear_examp: It's the most important tennis competition in my town, and I can't miss this opportunity.

senses.sense: to avoid doing or experiencing something
senses.dict_examp: You should leave early if you want to miss the rush hour.
senses.lear_examp: If you want to have a nice time, you should leave the hotel early in the morning because in this way you will miss the rush-hour traffic.

senses.sense: to not see or hear something
senses.dict_examp: Sorry, I missed that, could you repeat it please?
senses.lear_examp: First of all, the Festival began on time at midday with King Cup. Maybe you might have missed that part.

senses.sense: to fail to do something at the correct time or to be too late to do something or see something or someone
senses.dict_examp: I wanted to see that movie but I missed it.
senses.lear_examp: I missed the dinner I was going to have with my best friend in London.

senses.sense: to not hit or catch something as you intended
senses.dict_examp: It should have been such an easy goal and he missed.
senses.lear_examp: He aimed for the heart, and, when he was about to fire, an innocent pigeon landed on his rifle. Paul wasn't expecting this, and his shot missed the judge.

senses.sense: to be too late to do or get something
senses.dict_examp: I'm afraid you've missed the boat. The concert tickets have sold out.
senses.lear_examp: What if she never had another chance?  What if she missed the boat? Overcome by the anxiety and the lack of sleep, the first thing she did in the morning was to pick up two of her best poems and put them in an envelope.

senses.sense: to not do or have something that you would enjoy or something that other people do or have
senses.dict_examp: I got to the party too late and missed out on all the fun.
senses.lear_examp: They don't know what they are missing out on.

senses.sense: to behave badly
senses.dict_examp: If you misbehave, you will be punished - it's as simple as that.
senses.lear_examp: Firstly, an apology is due to all nearby residents whose lives were disturbed by a few somewhat misbehaving students.

senses.sense: to make a low sound, especially because you are in pain
senses.dict_examp: She lay on the floor moaning.
senses.lear_examp: He moaned and groaned but he did not have any obvious signs of injuries.

senses.sense: to complain or speak in a way that shows you are unhappy
senses.dict_examp: He's always moaning about something.
senses.lear_examp: She had been moaning all week about her job and her difficulties with this and that, but she couldn't remember having asked even once how Simon was getting along.

senses.sense: bad luck, or an unlucky event
senses.dict_examp: He had the misfortune to fall in love with a married woman.
senses.lear_examp: But try not to wear black because they believe it brings bad luck and misfortune.

senses.sense: If the weather is misty, there is a cloud of small drops of water in the air, which makes it difficult to see objects that are not near.
senses.dict_examp: a cold and misty morning
senses.lear_examp: But the evenings were a bit cold and misty.

senses.sense: If someone or something is missing, you cannot find them because they are not in their usual place.
senses.dict_examp: Her father has been missing since September 1992.
senses.lear_examp: Yesterday, when I reached home, I found that my note book was missing.

senses.sense: not included in something
senses.dict_examp: There are a couple of names missing from the list.
senses.lear_examp: But even with all this furniture, I feel like there is something missing, so I have decided to buy some posters of my favorite rock bands and put them on the walls.

senses.sense: something that is very surprising or difficult to believe
senses.dict_examp: an economic miracle
senses.lear_examp: Every single day we hear about new products, new methods, new technological miracles which have turned our daily lives upside down.

senses.sense: a piece of glass with a shiny metallic material on one side which produces an image of anything that is in front of it
senses.dict_examp: the bathroom mirror
senses.lear_examp: The mirror was given to me by Jenny.

senses.sense: something that you do or think that is wrong
senses.dict_examp: He made a lot of mistakes in his written test.
senses.lear_examp: You might need an eraser if you make a mistake.

senses.sense: If you do something by mistake, you do it without intending to.
senses.dict_examp: I picked up someone else's book by mistake.
senses.lear_examp: After 30 minutes, a man appeared telling us that he had taken our suitcases by mistake.

senses.sense: sad
senses.dict_examp: I just woke up feeling miserable.
senses.lear_examp: I feel very miserable and my boyfriend is still angry with me because that ring was his gift for our first year together.

senses.sense: very unpleasant or bad, and causing someone to feel unhappy
senses.dict_examp: miserable weather
senses.lear_examp: Heathcliff always swears revenge because of the miserable situation the other characters have put him in.

senses.sense: an explosive weapon which can travel long distances through the air
senses.dict_examp: nuclear missiles
senses.lear_examp: In the meantime dissident elements of the terrorist organization had tried to make contact with the United States intelligence organizations to warn them of possible bomb or missile attacks on their Kenyan and Tanzanian missions.

senses.sense: a way of doing something
senses.dict_examp: a mode of transport
senses.lear_examp: In conclusion, I think that both modes of education play a great role in educating children to be good members of society.

senses.sense: to a degree that is average but not very great
senses.dict_examp: There's very little moderately priced housing in this area.
senses.lear_examp: Very often a moderately well-off person would take his chance and try to change his life, hopefully for the better.

senses.sense: a mother
senses.dict_examp: I miss my mom and dad a lot.
senses.lear_examp: It is very important for me because my mom gave it to me for my birthday last year.

senses.sense: a screen that shows information or pictures, usually connected to a computer
senses.dict_examp: I bought a bigger monitor for my computer.
senses.lear_examp: We know our world from TV screens and computer monitors.

senses.sense: someone whose job is to watch or check something
senses.dict_examp: a class/school monitor
senses.lear_examp: On Wednesday the 13th I'll be a monitor in a studying group (it's a task due to my scholarship).

senses.sense: to watch and check someone or something carefully over a period of time
senses.dict_examp: to monitor progress
senses.lear_examp: As I said before, a close and personalized monitoring of the child (particularly when young) is very important, and the only way to do this is to reduce the number of students per class.

senses.sense: a hairy animal with a long tail that lives in hot countries and climbs trees
senses.dict_examp: Of all the animals at the zoo he liked the monkeys best.
senses.lear_examp: You can see animals like monkeys and birds, you can feed the fishes and also have a great meal at the restaurant.

senses.sense: a small change to something
senses.dict_examp: We've made a few modifications to the system.
senses.lear_examp: Although I am very happy with the current design of my house I may make some modifications in the future.

senses.sense: the round object that moves in the sky around the Earth and can be seen at night
senses.dict_examp: We gazed at the moon.
senses.lear_examp: There is a big window and from it I can see mountains, the sky, the moon and the sun.

senses.sense: not large in size or amount, or not expensive or important
senses.dict_examp: a modest amount of money
senses.lear_examp: It is an honour for us to receive such a well-known writer in our modest school.

senses.sense: If you are modest, you do not talk in a proud way about your skills or successes.
senses.dict_examp: He's very modest about his achievements.
senses.lear_examp: Earning a lot she is still very modest and does not show any signs of vanity at all.

senses.sense: the day of the week after Sunday and before Tuesday
senses.dict_examp: I start my new job on Monday.
senses.lear_examp: He goes to school Monday and Friday.

senses.sense: the continuing progress, motion, development, etc., that a person or thing is experiencing
senses.dict_examp: A falling object gains momentum as it falls.
senses.lear_examp: Mr. Emerson strongly believes in social equality, and his views can be regarded as the reflection of the democratic movements gaining momentum at the beginning of our century.

senses.sense: happening or produced once a month
senses.dict_examp: monthly payments
senses.lear_examp: At the moment I pay £550 monthly plus bills.

senses.sense: control by a company or group over all of a type of business or activity
senses.dict_examp: The Postal Service is guaranteed a monopoly on all first-class letters.
senses.lear_examp: In fact, it is quite obvious that the reason why a second supermarket is planned in our area is related to the current monopoly of the first supermarket.

senses.sense: If something is monotonous, it is boring because it stays the same.
senses.dict_examp: a monotonous voice
senses.lear_examp: The voice of the speaker is monotonous and lacks any rhythm or modulation, intrinsic parts of any language without which proper acquisition of it is impossible.

senses.sense: light that comes from the moon
senses.dict_examp: In the moonlight, she looked even more beautiful.
senses.lear_examp: The floor was dark, and the moonlight which came through the window gave the only light.

senses.sense: If you do something in moderation, you do not do it too much.
senses.dict_examp: I only drink alcohol in moderation.
senses.lear_examp: While shopping can make one feel good and even has its positive impact on the retail economy, I think it should be done in moderation.

senses.sense: average in size or amount and not too much
senses.dict_examp: a moderate income
senses.lear_examp: We have to eat healthy food and in moderate quantities, and to do our daily exercises.

senses.sense: to make something less extreme
senses.dict_examp: He's trying to moderate his drinking.

senses.sense: a design of machine or car that is made by a particular company
senses.dict_examp: a luxury/new model
senses.lear_examp: I like it very much, because it is the latest model and nobody at our school has it.

senses.sense: a smaller copy of a real object, often used to show how something works or what it looks like
senses.dict_examp: a model of the railroad
senses.lear_examp: I'm good at making models and telling stories.

senses.sense: someone whose job is to wear fashionable clothes, be in photographs, etc., in order to advertise things
senses.dict_examp: a fashion model
senses.lear_examp: In the future I hope to be a clothes designer or a top model.

senses.sense: someone or something that is an example for others to copy
senses.dict_examp: Their educational system was a model for other countries.
senses.lear_examp: She is a "model" citizen of the Fahrenheit 451 society: she doesn't ask questions, she doesn't think by herself, either.

senses.sense: the way you feel at a particular time
senses.dict_examp: She's in a bad mood.
senses.lear_examp: I reckon I was in a bad mood, but nothing had happened to end our relationship.

senses.sense: to not be friendly to other people because you are feeling angry
senses.dict_examp: Ignore him - he's in a mood.
senses.lear_examp: I didn't mind the rain, actually I prefer rain when I am in a mood like that.

senses.sense: to want to do or have something
senses.dict_examp: I'm not really in the mood for shopping at the moment.
senses.lear_examp: Should you be in the mood for a walk around the lake then go for it.

senses.sense: relating to beliefs about what is right or wrong
senses.dict_examp: moral values
senses.lear_examp: Her ideas and her moral values are pure, conveyed clearly and imparted to young children in spite of their lively jauntiness.

senses.sense: behaving in ways considered by most people to be correct and honest
senses.dict_examp: He's a highly moral man.
senses.lear_examp: Taking into account all these matters, we can see a moral, brave man fighting for his country and for what he believes in.

senses.sense: a lesson that can be learned from a story or event
senses.dict_examp: The moral of the story is never lie.
senses.lear_examp: The hidden moral she's trying to tell me is that I'll have to do everything by myself.

senses.sense: standards for good behavior
senses.dict_examp: He has no morals.
senses.lear_examp: Without limits, without morals, a child cannot build his own personality.

senses.sense: one of the twelve periods of time that a year is divided into
senses.dict_examp: February is the shortest month.
senses.lear_examp: I need to ask you, if I can start this course next month, in January, and finish in June.

senses.sense: a period of approximately four weeks
senses.dict_examp: She'll be working here for six months.
senses.lear_examp: My boy friend and I visit every winter for 3-4 months.

senses.sense: an old building or place that is important in history
senses.dict_examp: an ancient monument
senses.lear_examp: In these cities you will be able to visit ancient monuments.

senses.sense: a structure that is built to make people remember an event in history or a famous person
senses.dict_examp: In the square in front of the hotel stands a monument to all the people killed in the war.
senses.lear_examp: First I went to see the Larienki Park and admired the beautiful monument to the greatest Polish composer - Chopin.

senses.sense: by a small size or amount
senses.dict_examp: At just £9, the DVD is very modestly priced.

senses.sense: in a quiet way that does not show off your abilities, wealth, success, etc.
senses.dict_examp: She spoke modestly about her work.
senses.lear_examp: Some of them extravagantly and some modestly, depending on the status, importance and financial affordability of the people getting married.

senses.sense: now
senses.dict_examp: I'm afraid she's not here at the moment.
senses.lear_examp: Dear Sebastian, At the moment I'm in Spain.

senses.sense: a very short period of time
senses.dict_examp: I'll be back in a moment.
senses.lear_examp: I received your letter just a moment ago and I am happy that you are able to visit my country.

senses.sense: a point in time
senses.dict_examp: Just at that moment, the phone rang.
senses.lear_examp: At that moment my phone started to ring.

senses.sense: said in order to interrupt someone, or to get their attention or when you have suddenly thought of something important
senses.dict_examp: Now, wait a moment - I don't agree with that.

senses.sense: If you do something for the moment, you are doing it now, but might do something different in the future.
senses.dict_examp: Let's carry on with what we agreed for the moment.
senses.lear_examp: For the moment I am unemployed so I have plenty of time to give you a hand.

senses.sense: as soon as
senses.dict_examp: I'll call you the moment I hear anything.
senses.lear_examp: I think these differences become relevant from the moment that they decide they are going to make a fire.

senses.sense: If you do something on the spur of the moment, you do it suddenly, without planning it.
senses.dict_examp: On the spur of the moment we decided to go to London for the day.
senses.lear_examp: In reality, many people buy things on the spur of the moment only to discover later that they, in fact, do not meet their expectations.

senses.sense: using the newest ideas, design, technology, etc. and not traditional
senses.dict_examp: modern architecture/art/medicine
senses.lear_examp: I am going to use the green paint. I think it looks very modern.

senses.sense: relating to the present time and not to the past
senses.dict_examp: modern society
senses.lear_examp: You'll see the modern Japan.

senses.sense: the coins or bills  that are used to buy things
senses.dict_examp: How much money do you have?
senses.lear_examp: He is from England and he is very friendly and he  works a lot because he likes money.

senses.sense: an imaginary creature that is large, ugly, and frightening
senses.dict_examp: a sea monster
senses.lear_examp: It was a cartoon, telling a story about a monster, Stitch, who changed the life of a little girl called Lilo.

senses.sense: a cruel and frightening person
senses.dict_examp: To the whole world, he was a monster.
senses.lear_examp: In her opinion he was a monster without any human feelings.

senses.sense: relating to money
senses.dict_examp: monetary policy
senses.lear_examp: Indeed such a country, by accepting tourists, can exchange its probably weak currency with potentially hard currencies of strong monetary value, and help its economy.

senses.sense: to change something in order to improve it
senses.dict_examp: The plans will have to be modified to reduce costs.
senses.lear_examp: To sum up, the Work Experience in Britain program should be modified as it was a far cry from what we had been led to expect.

senses.sense: enthusiasm for doing something
senses.dict_examp: You need a lot of motivation to succeed.
senses.lear_examp: I hope my motivation and my hard work capacity can help me cope with the work successfully.

senses.sense: the need or reason for doing something
senses.dict_examp: One motivation for reducing the staff was the need to cut costs.
senses.lear_examp: Although money is the main motivation, for many people, to work, I have come across many people who have worked voluntarily or for less money to gain relevant experience.

senses.sense: a small flying insect that sucks your blood, sometimes causing malaria
senses.dict_examp: mosquito bites
senses.lear_examp: You should stay in a city because of the things that only a city can offer and an important detail about countryside is the mosquitoes, there are a lot!

senses.sense: to arrange a series of organized activities that will achieve a particular result
senses.dict_examp: Students mounted a huge protest against fee increases.
senses.lear_examp: In Orson Welles' story, aliens mount an offensive to take over the world, whereas in Wyndham's book, the world is quietly and slowly conquered by plants.

senses.sense: to increase in amount or level
senses.dict_examp: Tension in the room was mounting.
senses.lear_examp: One day, I was sitting in a dentist's waiting room, and as tension mounted and the old "dentist fear" was eating away at me, I availed myself of the opportunity to browse through a couple of magazines lying on the table.

senses.sense: to fix an object onto something
senses.dict_examp: They've mounted a camera on the wall by the door.
senses.lear_examp: He or any other guest will be happy to explain any of the items mounted on the wall and to reminisce about old times.

senses.sense: something strange or unknown which has not yet been explained or understood
senses.dict_examp: an unsolved mystery
senses.lear_examp: I have chosen this film because it has mystery in it and a lot of fun!!

senses.sense: someone who plays a musical instrument, often as a job
senses.dict_examp: a talented jazz/classical musician
senses.lear_examp: The movie is about two musicians that had to dress like women to escape from the gangsters of Chicago.

senses.sense: to speak quietly so that you can only be heard by someone near you
senses.dict_examp: "Go to sleep now," she murmured.
senses.lear_examp: "They're so unprofessional," he murmured to himself.

senses.sense: the sound of something being said quietly
senses.dict_examp: I could hear the low murmur of voices from behind the door.
senses.lear_examp: All Sandra could do was to nod every now and again to his murmurs.
